Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Ab F/C Ah, caught you smiling at me, thats the way it should be, like a leaf is to a tree so fine. Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Ab F/C Ah, all the good times we had, I sang love songs so glad, al_ways smiling, never sad so fine.

G Bb F/C Ab Bb F/C Ab Bb F/C As we walk down a country lane, I'll be singing a song, you'll hear me calling your name. G Bb F/C Ab Hear the wind whisper in the trees telling Mother Nature 'bout you and me. Bb F/C Ab Bb F/C

Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Ab F/C Well. if the sun shines so bright, or our way is darkest night, the road we choose is always right, so fine. Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab Ah, can a love be so strong when so many loves go wrong? Will our A Bb Ab F/C love go on and on, and on, and on, and on, and on?

G Bb F/C Ab Bb F/C Ab Bb F/C As we walk down a country lane, while singing a song, hear me calling your name. G Bb F/C Ab Hear the wind Whisper in the trees, telling Mother Nature 'bout you and me. Bb F/C Ab Bb F/C

F/C Ab Bb F/C F/C Ab Bb F/C F/C Ab Bb F/C My, my Lordy Lord come on now it ain't too far. F/C Ab Bb F/C Tell your friends all around the world ain't no companion like a blue eyed merle. Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Ab F/C So of one thing I am sure, it's a friendship so pure, an_gels singing all around my door so fine. Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Bb F/C Ab A Bb Ab F/C Yeah, Ain't but one thing to do, spend my na'tral life with you, you're the finest dog I knew so fine.
